com.suarez.cordova.mapsforge

Class MapsforgeCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.suarez.cordova.mapsforge.MapsforgeCache

  • public class MapsforgeCache
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a tile cache using mapsforge libraries. When a tile is not available in cache, it will create it and store it in the cache (if there is space available).
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Adolfo Fernandez Suarez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MapsforgeCache INSTANCE
      Remember to initialize this instance with MapsforgeCache.createInstance in order to avoid getting a null object, and therefore NullPointerException when invoking any method.

    • Field Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static MapsforgeCache INSTANCE
        Remember to initialize this instance with MapsforgeCache.createInstance in order to avoid getting a null object, and therefore NullPointerException when invoking any method.

    • Method Detail

      • createInstance

        public static void createInstance(Activity context,
                  java.lang.String mapFilePath)
        Creates a new instance for the tile cache using the map file provided.
        Parameters:
        context - Cordova activity. Get it from the main plugin class through the cordova object.
        mapFilePath - Absolute path to the map file.

      • getCacheName

        public java.lang.String getCacheName()
        Returns the cache name. This is the name of the folder that contains the images.
        Returns:
        The name of the cache

      • getCleanCacheTrigger

        public int getCleanCacheTrigger()
        Returns the cleanCacheTrigger property. This property avoids the cache to use all the space available in its partition.
        Returns:
        The size(in MB) that should be preserved.

      • getContext

        public Activity getContext()
        Returns the context used when the cache was created.
        Returns:
        The current context of this cache

      • getGraphicFactory

        public org.mapsforge.map.android.graphics.AndroidGraphicFactory getGraphicFactory()
        Returns the graphic factory instance used in this cache.
        Returns:
        The instance of AndroidGraphicFactory used in the cache

      • getMapFilePath

        public java.lang.String getMapFilePath()
        Returns the path of the map file that mapsforge is using
        Returns:
        The path to the map file(.map).

      • getMaxCacheAge

        public long getMaxCacheAge()
        Returns the maxCacheAge. This is the attribute used for deleting the images from the cache when the cleaning process starts. This avoids the deleting of images that are being used in the UI.
        Returns:
        The age, in milliseconds, from which the images will be deleted

      • getMaxCacheSize

        public int getMaxCacheSize()
        Returns the maxCacheSize attribute. The default value for this attribute is 25MB, but if there is no enough space, it will be adjusted to fit the available space.
        Returns:
        The maximum size for this cache(in MB)

      • getOverdrawFactor

        public float getOverdrawFactor()
        Returns:
        The overdraw factor used for the tile rendering

      • getScreenRatio

        public float getScreenRatio()
        Returns:
        Screen ratio for creating the tile's images. By default it is set to 1f.

      • getTilePath

        public java.lang.String getTilePath(long x,
                           long y,
                           byte zoom)
        This method will return the path to the tile image that represents the given coordinates and zoom. If the cache is enabled, it will render the image iff it is not available in the cache. If the cache it is not enabled, it will render the image always, even if there is a previous one already stored in the device.
        Parameters:
        x - Latitude point
        y - Longitude point
        zoom - Zoom
        Returns:
        The absolute path to the tile image

      • getTileSize

        public int getTileSize()
        Returns the tile size. This is the size of the images that will be generated, and by default its value is 256.
        Returns:
        The tile image size

      • isCacheEnabled

        public boolean isCacheEnabled()
        Returns the flag that indicates whether or not the cache is enabled
        Returns:
        True if the cache is enabled, false otherwise

      • isCleanOnDestroy

        public boolean isCleanOnDestroy()
        Returns the flag that indicates whether or not the cache should be deleted when executing the onDestroy method.
        Returns:
        True if the cache will be deleted, false otherwise

      • isExternalCache

        public boolean isExternalCache()
        Returns the flag that indicates whether or not it's being used the external cache(SD card).
        Returns:
        True if the cache is in the SD card, false otherwise

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Destroys the temporal images that have been generated, and cleans up the cache if the flag for that is set up.

      • setCacheEnabled

        public void setCacheEnabled(boolean cacheEnabled)
        Enables or disables the cache. If the cache is not enabled, the images will be generated always from scratch, so it will be slower than with a cache.
        Parameters:
        cacheEnabled - True to enable cache, false to disable

      • setCacheName

        public void setCacheName(java.lang.String cacheName)
        Set the name for the cache. Basically this is going to be the name of the folder within the cache directory. Changing it will destroy the previous cache (if exists).
        Parameters:
        cacheName - New name for the cache

      • setCleanCacheTrigger

        public void setCleanCacheTrigger(int cleanCacheTrigger)
        Sets up the trigger to clean the cache. This means that the cache will always preserve free in memory the MB specified for the trigger. This may be useful in order to prevent the cache to use all available space.
        Parameters:
        cleanCacheTrigger - Size(in MB) that will be kept free in memory

      • setCleanOnDestroy

        public void setCleanOnDestroy(boolean cleanOnDestroy)
        Enables or disables the deletion of the cache when the onDestroy method is called.
        Parameters:
        cleanOnDestroy - True to delete the cache, false to preserve it.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(Activity context)
        Sets up the application context.
        Parameters:
        context - The new context

      • setExternalCache

        public void setExternalCache(boolean externalCache)
        Enables or disables the external cache(SD card). If there is no SD card, the cache will be placed in the internal device memory.
        Parameters:
        externalCache - True to place the cache in the SD card, false to internal storage

      • setGraphicFactory

        public void setGraphicFactory(org.mapsforge.map.android.graphics.AndroidGraphicFactory graphicFactory)
        Sets the AndroidGraphicFactory that will be used to generate tiles. If the factory has not been created yet, a new one will be created.
        Parameters:
        graphicFactory - The AndroidGraphicFactory instance or null to create a new one

      • setMapFilePath

        public void setMapFilePath(java.lang.String mapFilePath)
        Sets the map file that will be used for rendering. If the map file doesn't exist, or it has not the required extension(map) an exception will be logged with ERROR level.
        Parameters:
        mapFilePath - Absolute file path to the map file

      • setMaxCacheAge

        public void setMaxCacheAge(long maxCacheAge)
        Sets the max age for the cached images. This means that when the cache is cleaned, every image that has not been used in the last maxCacheAge milliseconds will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        maxCacheAge - Maximum milliseconds to keep the images when the cache is cleaned

      • setMaxCacheSize

        public void setMaxCacheSize(int maxCacheSize)
        Sets up the maximum cache size. If the cache exceeds this size, it will be cleaned. This attribute has to be greater than cleanCacheTrigger, if not, the trigger will be set up to half the maximum cache size.
        Parameters:
        maxCacheSize - Maximum cache size(in MB)

      • setOverdrawFactor

        public void setOverdrawFactor(float overdrawFactor)
        Sets up the overdraw factor that will be used for rendering the tiles. By default its value is 1.2f.
        Parameters:
        overdrawFactor - New overdraw factor

      • setRenderTheme

        public void setRenderTheme(java.lang.String renderThemePath)
        Changes the render theme to the new one provided. If it doesn't exist, the theme will not be changed.
        Parameters:
        renderThemePath - Absolute path to the theme file

      • setScreenRatio

        public void setScreenRatio(float screenRatio)
        Changes the screen ratio used when the images are generated. By default its value is 1f.
        Parameters:
        screenRatio - New screen ratio

      • setTileSize

        public void setTileSize(int tileSize)
        Sets the size of the images generated. By default its value is 256.
        Parameters:
        tileSize - New tile size
